questions.question: Higher value of elongation index can be achieved by which of the following type of  aggregates?
Elongation index test is used to assess the suitability mainly of ______
What is the recommended maximum elongation index for aggregates used in asphalt concrete
Which of the following statement is correct

answers.a: Higher elongation index indicates better quality of aggregates
answers.b: Lower elongation index indicates better quality of aggregates
answers.c: Elongation index does not define the quality of aggregates.

questions.question: An aggregate sample has an elongation index of 15%. If the weight of particles retained on the 25 mm sieve is 225g, calculate the weight of aggregates passing through the sieve
The total weight of aggregate sample is 1850 g and the weight of the aggregates passing through the 25 mm sieve is found to be 1200 g. Calculate the elongation index of the sample
Elongation index of aggregates is defined as the percentage by weight of particles whose length is greater than which of the following?
If an aggregate sample has a total weight of 500 g and the weight of elongated particles is 75 g, what is the elongation index?
Which sieve is typically used for the elongation index test to separate elongated particles from the aggregate sample?
An aggregate sample of 2000 g contains elongated particles weighing 320 g. If the elongation index requirement for high-quality aggregates is a maximum of 20%, does this sample meet the requirement?

answers.a: Yes, the elongation index is 16% which is within the limit
answers.b: No, the elongation index is 32% which exceeds the limit
answers.c: Yes, the elongation index is 20% which matches exactly
answers.d: No, the elongation index is 24% which exceeds the limit

explanations.a: Calculation: (320/2000) × 100 = 16%, which is less than 20% here
